description.value:
Totem of Unicorn

Totem Spirit (Wisdom) — Creation Cost: 7 Gnosis

Spirit Aspect: Harmony / Grace / Compassionate Resolve

Recommended Umbra Spirits (CR 8+)

To bind Unicorn, the pack must confront a spirit of harmony, sacrifice, and untainted passage. Suitable spirits include:

  • Elder Silver-Hoof Vision Spirit (Unicorn Aspect) — Suggested base: Sphinx- or guardian-fey–style spirit (CR 10–12), reflavored as a spirit of grace and unity
  • Waykeeper of Gaia's Children — Suggested base: Nature or celestial guardian (CR 9–11), stripped of planar alignment and treated as a Wisdom spirit
  • Horizon-Walker Spirit — Suggested base: Air or nature elemental (CR 8–10), focused on movement, healing acts, and protection rather than damage

These spirits test empathy, restraint, and willingness to sacrifice advantage for others.

Individual Trait

The creature who touches the Totem gains the following benefit until the next long rest:

  • Your movement speed increases by 10 feet
  • You gain proficiency in Medicine and Survival (if you already have proficiency, you gain expertise instead)
  • You have advantage on Wisdom (Medicine) checks and Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to calm, heal, or comfort others

Only one creature may benefit from this trait at a time.

Pack Trait

As an action, a creature touching the Totem may invoke Unicorn's grace.

For 1 minute, while within 30 feet of the Totem:

  • Pack members ignore nonmagical difficult terrain
  • Pack members have advantage on Dexterity saving throws
  • When a pack member restores hit points to another creature, that creature regains additional hit points equal to the healer's proficiency bonus (once per creature per round)

This reflects Unicorn's speed in the Umbra, harmony in motion, and collective healing focus.

Drawback — Reluctance to Harm the Pure

Unicorn's compassion tempers violence.

When a pack member makes an attack roll against a Garou or non-Wyrm humanoid, they do so with disadvantage the first time each combat.

This drawback does not apply if the target is Wyrm-tainted, actively committing atrocities, or poses an immediate lethal threat. This drawback is always in effect while the Totem is active.

Ban — Protect Gaia's Children

Unicorn demands compassion backed by action.

The pack must aid and protect the weak, exploited, or defenseless, except when doing so would directly aid the Wyrm.

Willful refusal to offer aid when it is reasonably possible causes the Totem to become dormant and all its benefits cease.

To restore the Totem, the pack leader must reinvest the required Gnosis cost to reaffirm the bond.

If the pack repeatedly or egregiously violates this Ban, Unicorn may withdraw entirely, permanently severing itself from the Totem at the Storyteller's discretion.

Totem rules: Only one Totem per pack; benefits do not stack; a dormant Totem provides no benefits. Once a Totem benefit is used, it cannot be used again until after a long rest. Interacting with a Totem requires 1 action while touching it; choose either the Individual Trait or the Pack Trait.
